Prasanth Suresh

102 College Station Road, Athens, GA - 30605 · (720) 338-1240 · prasuchit@gmail.com

A Roboticist and Artificial Intelligence Researcher. I strive to deeply understand the reality I live in.

Experience

Graduate Research Assistant

THINC Lab, University of Georgia
  • I work on hard AI problems in fulfilment with Robotics. This includes fundamental computer vision and robot manipulation work to handle objects faster and better.
  • My research is multifaceted, involving object recognition, reinforcement learning, robot grasping, trajectory optimisation and general machine learning and control for robotics.
  • I'm currently working on a project funded by the National Science Foundation - National Robotics Initiative. This project is on track to be deployed as a commercial automated solution to vegetable sorting on conveyor lines.
January 2019 - Present

Robotics Intern

RIF Robotics
Supervisor: Dr.Kevin DeMarco
  • Developed a perception based pick and place pipeline for sorting and kitting surgical instruments.
  • Built the entire stack on ROS2 and Moveit2, the latest and most widely used robotics architecture.
June 2018 - August 2018

Robotics Intern

Lunar Outpost
  • Worked on ROS Navstack for Autonomous Navigation on an ARM controller using 3D LiDAR Mapping for a Mobile Robotics Platform.
  • Developed Teleoperation capabilities, Multi-sensor integration, RGB cam based 360 deg live streaming, helped develop on board Electronics, and Mechanical Subsystems.
June 2018 - August 2018

Graduate Researcher

MirrorLab, Colorado School of Mines
  • Integrated Robot Architectures DIARC and ROS to realize an Alpine Search and Rescue(S&R) Scenario in ROS Gazebo.
  • Pipeline development between DIARC and ROS to pass NLP commands to ROS and the feedback to DIARC.
  • Worked with researchers from University of Bremen, Germany to implement this pipeline on a ROS Gazebo based UAV alpine S&R Platform.
Aug 2017 - May 2018

Interests

Physics aficionado, neuroscience admirer, fitness enthusiast and an emistemophiliac.

With a penchant for biology I would've become a neuroscientist. Instead, now I build and study robot brains! ;)

I'm mostly a homebody, I like my space and the peace that comes with it.

I like to go for long walks along natural trails while listening to mellifluous music and pondering the meaning of life.

Publications

  • Asali, Ehsan, Farzan Shenavarmasouleh, Farid Ghareh Mohammadi, Prasanth Sengadu Suresh, and Hamid R. Arabnia. "Deepmsrf: A novel deep multimodal speaker recognition framework with feature selection." In Advances in Computer Vision and Computational Biology, pp. 39-56. Springer, Cham, 2021.
  • Suresh, Prasanth Sengadu, and Prashant Doshi. "Marginal MAP Estimation for Inverse RL under Occlusion with Observer Noise." arXiv preprint arXiv:2109.07788 (2021).
